intro: Convolvulus breviflorus, commonly known as the short-flowered morning glory, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous annual that grows up to 30 centimeters in height, featuring slender, hairy stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, funnel-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color, blooming in the morning and closing by midday. Its flowers are pollinated by insects, and the plant thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. Convolvulus breviflorus is often found in disturbed areas and along roadsides.
